articles.title: Pakistan fights back in second Test against Sri Lanka
articles.description: Pakistan's batsmen have bounced back after the first innings debacle to throw open the second Test against Sri Lanka in Colombo.

articles.title: Bulldogs sneak home against the Saints
articles.description: Western Bulldogs have withstood a final quarter comeback by St Kilda to win by six points at Docklands and grab a spot in the eight.

articles.title: Waratahs' Super Rugby defence over in semi-final loss to Highlanders
articles.description: The Waratahs' Super Rugby title defence ends at the semi-final stage after losing 35-17 to the Highlanders at the Sydney Football Stadium.

articles.title: Rampant Radradra leads Eels to 16-12 win over Dragons
articles.description: A hat-trick of tries to Semi Radradra has seen the Eels defeat St George Illawarra 16-12 at Parramatta Stadium.

articles.title: Crows come from the clouds to beat Lions
articles.description: The Adelaide Crows have maintained their place in the top eight with a final quarter comeback win over the Brisbane Lions at the Gabba.

articles.title: Cowboys' winning run comes to an end as Sharks complete big comeback
articles.description: The North Queensland Cowboys' winning run of 11 games has come to an end after the Cronulla Sharks completed a comeback 24-18 win in Townsville.

articles.title: Hurricanes belt Brumbies to reach Super Rugby decider
articles.description: The table-topping Hurricanes make the Super Rugby grand final after beating the Brumbies 29-9 in Wellington.

articles.title: Mitchell regrets making injection gesture mocking Essendon over ASADA troubles
articles.description: Hawthorn midfielder Sam Mitchell says he should not have mocked Essendon over the supplements sage, while James Hird described the incident as 'disappointing'.

articles.title: Live: Waratahs v Highlanders
articles.description: Follow the Super Rugby semi-finals live as the Waratahs take on the Highlanders.

articles.title: Warriors romp to 30-8 win over Raiders
articles.description: The New Zealand Warriors put in a convincing display to beat the Canberra Raiders 30-8 in Auckland.

articles.title: Hawthorn puts in blistering second half to trounce Essendon by 38 points
articles.description: Hawthorn has piled pressure on James Hird and Essendon with a punishing 38-point win at the MCG.

articles.title: Australian Sam Soliman loses to Dominic Wade in controversial decision
articles.description: Australia's Sam Soliman has suffers a contentious 10-round split-decision points loss to unbeaten American professional Dominic Wade in the United States.

articles.title: Sea of purple and yellow for Firebirds' tickertape parade
articles.description: Brisbane is splashed with purple and yellow at a tickertapeÂ parade to celebrate the Queensland Firebirds' grand final win.

articles.title: Matildas head into Japan clash in top condition and confident despite underdog status
articles.description: Matildas coach Alen Stajcic says his side's poor recent record against quarter-finals opponent Japan will count for little on Sunday.

articles.title: Rugby league teams #takeakneeforackers before weekend matches
articles.description: Tributes to Sunshine Coast footballer James Ackerman are being held at rugby league matches across Queensland and interstate this weekend.

articles.title: McGuire' season-ending injury hits Broncos hard
articles.description: Inspiration was all around after Brisbane forward Josh McGuire suffered a season-ending Achilles tendon injury in the Broncos' 44-22 win over Newcastle at Lang Park on Friday night.

articles.title: Women's Football World Cup boosts female participation
articles.description: Northern New South Wales Football says the Women's World Cup and other big football events are helping girls realise the potential of competitive football as a career option.

articles.title: Batting powerplays gone from ODIs in bonus for bowlers
articles.description: Batting powerplays have been scrapped from one-day international cricket and field restrictions relaxed to provide some relief to bowlers, who were set upon mercilessly at the World Cup.

articles.title: Watson remains in control in Connecticut
articles.description: Bubba Watson was not fazed by strong winds and trickier pin positions as he rolled right along with an error-free day to earn a two-shot lead after the second round of the US PGA Tour event in Cromwell.

articles.title: Germany advances on penalties to Women's World Cup semis
articles.description: Top-ranked Germany won a dramatic penalty shoot-out 5-4 against France to advance to the semi-finals at the Women's World Cup in Montreal.

articles.title: Farah to continue working with under-fire Salazar
articles.description: Great Britain's double Olympic champion Mo Farah will continue to work with Alberto Salazar despite the doping allegations surrounding his coach.

articles.title: Radwanska to face Bencic in Eastbourne final
articles.description: Agnieszka Radwanska returned to the final of the Eastbourne International for the first time since 2008, as the ninth seed defeated Sloane Stephens 6-1, 6-7 (3-7), 6-2 in a windswept showdown.

articles.title: Aussie Sharks beaten at World League Super Finals
articles.description: The Australian men's water polo team have sustained an agonising quarter-final loss to tournament surprise Brazil at the FINA World League Super Finals in Bergamo, Italy.

articles.title: Kookaburras beat Poland 4-0 at Hockey World League
articles.description: Strikes from Kieran and Blake Govers, Jake Whetton and Simon Orchard cemented Australia's place at the summit of Pool A at the Hockey World League with a 4-0 win over Poland in Antwerp.

articles.title: Smith lets his 'bat do the talking' with Kent ton
articles.description: Steven Smith says he wants to let his bat "do the talking" after the world's number one-ranked Test batsman opened his Ashes tour account with a century against Kent.

articles.title: Sri Lankans lead Pakistan by 166 runs after day two
articles.description: Sri Lanka was 9 for 304 at stumps on day two of the second Test against Pakistan in Colombo, a lead of 166 runs on first innings.

articles.title: Broncos coach Bennett unleashes on NRL as Origin injury count rises
articles.description: Brisbane Broncos coach Wayne Bennett has launched a scathing attack at the NRL as the list of injured State of Origin players increased.

articles.title: Riewoldt kicks six as Tigers stun Swans
articles.description: A six-goal haul from Tigers spearhead Jack Riewoldt has spurred a brilliant comeback win for Richmond over the Sydney Swans.

articles.title: Rabbitohs defeat Sea Eagles at Olympic stadium
articles.description: South Sydney has moved up to fourth on the NRL ladder with a 20-8 win over Manly at the Olympic stadium.

articles.title: Broncos run away with 44-22 win over Knights despite injury worries
articles.description: A hot start and a fast finish has led the Brisbane Broncos to a convincing 44-22 win over the Newcastle Knights at Lang Park.

articles.title: Tomic, Hewitt cop nasty Wimbledon draws
articles.description: Australian number one Bernard Tomic and former champion Lleyton Hewitt cop nasty draws at Wimbledon as a massive Australian contingent plots its charge.

articles.title: Socceroo hero Kennedy announces retirement
articles.description: Former Socceroo and Melbourne City striker Josh Kennedy has announces his retirement from professional football.

articles.title: Boxing Day Test to stay in Melbourne, says CA
articles.description: Cricket Australia has rejected a media report that the Boxing Day Test could be moved from the MCG.

articles.title: Dank handed lifetime ban by AFL Anti-Doping Tribunal
articles.description: The AFL Anti-Doping Tribunal hands down a lifetime ban to controversial sports scientist Stephen Dank over his role in the Essendon supplements saga.

articles.title: Olympic gold the next goal: Bogut
articles.description: NBA champion Andrew Bogut says a gold medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics would round off his basketball career and believes it is Australia's best chance.

articles.title: Wolves take Towns with first pick in NBA draft
articles.description: Teen big man Karl-Anthony Towns was selected by the Minnesota Timberwolves with the first pick in the NBA draft, while Europeans were taken with two of the first five selections.

articles.title: Matildas face tough, familiar foe in Japan
articles.description: After some physical battles en route to the last eight of the Women's World Cup, the Matildas will face a very different challenge against defending champions Japan in the quarter-final.

articles.title: Waratahs to share the load of absent Beale
articles.description: New South Wales coach Michael Cheika says his side will share the inside centre role a bit more than usual with Kurtley Beale unavailable for Saturday night's Super Rugby semi-final against the Highlanders.

articles.title: McCullum joins Brisbane Heat on three-year BBL deal
articles.description: Black Caps skipper Brendon McCullum has signed for Big bash League side Brisbane Heat on a three-year deal.

articles.title: Gallen to miss Cowboys clash with rib injury
articles.description: Cronulla and New South Wales skipper Paul Gallen will miss Saturday's NRL clash with North Queensland because of a rib injury sustained in Origin II.

articles.title: North Melbourne AFL coach will not be charged over alleged assault in Hobart
articles.description: North Melbourne AFL coach Brad Scott will not be charged over an alleged assault against a security guard in Hobart.

articles.title: Fittest man in the Illawarra heads to New York to compete in world Cross Fit Games
articles.description: A fitness trainer from the Southern Highlands will fly to Los Angeles next month in a bid to become the planet's fittest man

articles.title: Watson shrugs off US Open flop, grabs Travelers lead
articles.description: Bubba Watson puts his disappointing US Open behind him with a brilliant start to the Travelers Championship that gave him a two-shot lead after the first round.

articles.title: German sprinter Kittel out of Tour de France
articles.description: German sprint star Marcel Kittel will miss this year's Tour de France as he struggles to recover from a virus.

articles.title: Former league star Blake hit with betting ban in English rugby
articles.description: Former Australia rugby league star Phil Blake has become the first person to be banned by England's governing Rugby Football Union (RFU) for breaching rules relating to betting and anti-corruption.

articles.title: Rafter hits back in feud with John Tomic
articles.description: Iron-fisted head of player performance director Pat Rafter has hit back at John Tomic and says Tennis Australia will no longer fund his children's careers.

articles.title: League clubs plan tributes for footballer who died after tackle
articles.description: Tributes will be held at rugby league games nationwide this weekend for Sunshine Coast footballer and father of two James Ackerman, who died after being tackled in a match.

articles.title: Confusion as Bolt declines to race in Jamaican trials
articles.description: Mystery and confusion engulf Usain Bolt after he declines to race in the 100 metres at Jamaica's national trials, raising concerns about his fitness ahead of the world championships.

articles.title: FFA, A-League players war over pay deal
articles.description: A-League players reject the latest pay deal from FFA, which the governing body says is putting self-interest ahead of the good of the game.

articles.title: Hockeyroos lose to Black Sticks in Blyth's record-breaking game
articles.description: The Hockeyroos fall 2-0 to New Zealand at the Hockey World League meet in Belgium in a historic game for captain Madonna Blyth.

articles.title: Qualifying wins confirm Australia's largest Wimbledon tilt in 20 years
articles.description: Qualifying wins for Luke Saville, John Millman and John-Patrick Smith give Australia its largest Wimbledon contingent in 20 years.

articles.title: Wozniacki through to Eastbourne semis, Gavrilova out with ab injury
articles.description: Former champion Caroline Wozniacki reaches the semi-finals of the Eastbourne International, while Russian-born Australian Daria Gavrilova withdrew from her quarter-final due to an abdominal strain.

articles.title: Ton-up Marsh leads way for Australia in tour match
articles.description: Shaun Marsh marks the opening match of Australia's Ashes tour of England with a century against Kent at Canterbury in a bid to retain his Test place.

articles.title: Dockers hold on to seven-point win over Pies in thriller
articles.description: Fremantle's stars stood up in a tense final quarter to deliver the league-leading Dockers a seven-point win over Collingwood at Subiaco Oval.

articles.title: The mid-season AFL All Australian team
articles.description: The first half of the 2015 AFL season has come and gone, and the best teams and players have begun to reveal themselves - here is Grandstand's All Australian team so far.

articles.title: Live: Sydney vs Richmond
articles.description: Follow the action from round 13 of the AFL with the Sydney Swans playing host to the Richmond Tigers at the SCG on Friday night.

articles.title: Live: St Kilda v Western Bulldogs
articles.description: Follow the action from round 13 of the AFL as St Kilda faces the Western Bulldogs.

articles.title: Ablett not named by Suns for Blues clash
articles.description: Gary Ablett's much-anticipated return from a shoulder injury has been put off for at least another week, with the Gold Coast superstar not named for Sunday's clash with Carlton.

articles.title: Brumbies set to appeal Speight's five-week ban
articles.description: The Brumbies will appeal winger Henry Speight's five-week ban, which their chief executive has labelled a "cruel and unusual punishment".

articles.title: Young kayakers take up place in Australia's gold medal-winning K4 team
articles.description: There has been a changing of the guard in Australian kayaking, with two young paddlers replacing two veteran members of the Olympics gold medal-winning men's K4.

articles.title: Beale ruled out of Waratahs' Super Rugby semi-final
articles.description: New South Wales has lost Kurtley Beale to a quadriceps injury ahead of Saturday's Super Rugby semi-final against the Highlanders at Sydney Football Stadium.

articles.title: Beale sits out Waratahs' training ahead of Super Rugby semi
articles.description: New South Wales Waratahs playmaker Kurtley Beale will have a fitness test on Friday to determine if he plays in this weekend's Super Rugby semi-final against the Highlanders in Sydney.

articles.title: Stopping Folau vital in Super Rugby semi: Smith
articles.description: Waratahs full-back Israel Folau must be stymied in the Super Rugby semi-final, according to Highlanders opposite Ben Smith.

articles.title: Bayliss plays straight bat on Pietersen selection
articles.description: England coach Trevor Bayliss refused to be drawn on whether he wants Kevin Pietersen in his Ashes squad, while saying he was impressed by the team's recent performances against New Zealand.

articles.title: Blues moving on from Gibbs suspension
articles.description: Carlton caretaker coach John Barker says the club is frustrated to be left under-manned by Bryce Gibbs's two-match ban.

articles.title: Titans snare Raiders' Shillington in NRL deal
articles.description: The Gold Coast Titans enjoy some recruitment success, snapping up former Test forward David Shillington for the next two NRL seasons.

articles.title: Toovey moves to keep Foran at Sea Eagles
articles.description: Manly Sea Eagles coach Geoff Toovey has spoken with Kieran Foran in a bid to keep the star playmaker at Brookvale beyond the 2015 NRL season.

articles.title: Australian Wimbledon challenge could be biggest in 20 years
articles.description: Tennis battlers Luke Saville, John Millman and John-Patrick Smith are set to give Australia its largest Wimbledon contingent in 20 years.

articles.title: McEnroe tipping Kyrgios to cause damage at Wimbledon
articles.description: Three-time champion John McEnroe has nominated Australian Nick Kyrgios as the man to "shake up" Wimbledon once again.

articles.title: Kookaburras beat Pakistan 6-1 in Hockey World League
articles.description: The Kookaburras remain top of their pool at the Hockey World League, after a 6-1 win over Pakistan.

articles.title: Seeds fall at Nottingham grass court event
articles.description: Spain's Feliciano Lopez led the list of seeds knocked out in the third round at the Nottingham grasscourt tournament.

articles.title: Springboks celebrate 20th World Cup anniversary, predict more glory
articles.description: Former South African fly half Joel Stransky says the Springboks can repeat history, winning a second Rugby World Cup 20 years after their first triumph.

articles.title: Hockeyroos keep momentum with 2-0 win over Belgium
articles.description: Captain Madonna Blyth produces stunning save in the Hockeyroos' 2-0 win over host nation Belgium at the Hockey World League.

articles.title: Drugs not a big issue at West Coast: Kerr
articles.description: Former West Coast midfielder Daniel Kerr denies illicit drugs were a widespread issue at the club during his 220-game AFL career.

articles.title: Rogers says sorry for trying to re-sell free Ashes tickets
articles.description: Australian opener Chris Rogers apologises after company sells Lord's Ashes Test tickets for up to $5,914.

articles.title: India beats Bangladesh by 77 runs to avoid ODI whitewash
articles.description: India beats Bangladesh by 77 runs in the third and final ODI in Dhaka, spearheaded by half-centuries from Shikhar Dhawan and MS Dhoni.

articles.title: Wozniacki into Eastbourne last-eight, Bouchard injured
articles.description: Second seed Carolione Wozniacki beat former champion Svetlana Kuznetsova at Eastbourne while injury forced Eugenie Bouchard to retire against Belinda Bencic.

articles.title: Manchester City to play Melbourne City on Gold Coast
articles.description: Manchester City will face sister club Melbourne City on the Gold Coast as part of an 11-day training camp in the lead-up to the International Champions Cup.

articles.title: Kyrgios, Tomic and Stosur seeded for Wimbledon
articles.description: Nick Kyrgios, Bernard Tomic and Samantha Stosur are rewarded with seedings at Wimbledon as the Australian contingent plan their charge at the All England Club.

articles.title: Jackson cleared for Origin III as downgrade is approved by NRL judiciary
articles.description: Canterbury back rower Josh Jackson is free to play in Origin III for New South Wales after successfully getting his dangerous throw charge downgraded by the NRL judiciary.

articles.title: Former Matilda Shipard says Matildas live in 'different world' due to pay discrepancy
articles.description: Former Matildas star Sally Shipard describes the "different world" Australia's women's national team operates in after details emerged of the player's pay discrepancy compared to the Socceroos.

articles.title: Eels hit out at 'self-serving' individuals, vow to uphold Foran deal
articles.description: Parramatta chairman Steve Sharp says the club has been the victim of unwarranted and vicious attacks and that "self-serving" individuals are seeking to destabilise it.

articles.title: Victory captain Milligan confirms move to Baniyas in UAE
articles.description: Melbourne Victory captain Mark Milligan has ended weeks of speculation around his future by announcing a move to Abu Dhabi-based club Baniyas.

articles.title: Ablett among stars set to return for Suns
articles.description: Superstar skipper Gary Ablett is among a host of Gold Coast players who could return from injury in Sunday's AFL clash with Carlton.

articles.title: Speight to miss Brumbies' semi-final against Hurricanes
articles.description: The Brumbies will be without Henry Speight for Saturday's Super Rugby semi-final against the Hurricanes.

articles.title: Ellis poised to face Samoa after four years in wilderness
articles.description: Half-back Andy Ellis is "definitely likely" to play for the All Blacks against Samoa next month after almost four years out of the national squad.

articles.title: Matildas to meet defending champs Japan in World Cup quarter-final
articles.description: The Matildas will reignite their rivalry with Japan in their Women's World Cup quarter-final after the defending champions beat The Netherlands 2-1 in Vancouver.

articles.title: Prominent Victorian greyhound trainer banned for life for live baiting
articles.description: Prominent Victorian greyhound identity Anthony Mills is banned from racing for life after being found guilty of live baiting.

articles.title: Bogut 'can't wait' to play for Boomers after winning NBA title
articles.description: Andrew Bogut signals his intent to return to the Boomers' line-up for their Olympic qualifiers after winning an NBA title with Golden State.

articles.title: Paige Hadley earns shock selection in Diamonds' experienced World Cup squad
articles.description: New South Wales Swifts star Paige Hadley is a shock inclusion in an experienced Diamonds squad for the 2015 Netball World Cup to be held in Sydney in August.

articles.title: Brumbies likely to lose Speight for Super Rugby final through suspension
articles.description: Brumbies winger Henry Speight is likely to be ruled out of the Super Rugby semi-final after a judicial hearing found he had contravened a lifting tackle law.

articles.title: Matildas pay dwarfed by that of Socceroos, PFA calls for more equality
articles.description: The PFA says low wages for the Matildas could be hindering development of the women's game, with the Socceroos earning substantially more.

articles.title: Not the right time for Hunt to enter Origin fray: Hodges
articles.description: Despite another Daly Cherry-Evans misfire, Justin Hodges says the time is not yet right for Brisbane teammate Ben Hunt's State of Origin call-up.

articles.title: England go into Ashes on a high after beating New Zealand in Twenty20 international
articles.description: New Zealand's tour of England ends in heavy defeat, losing the one-off Twenty20 International in Manchester by 56 runs.

articles.title: Australia falls to Italy in opening FINA World League Super Finals game
articles.description: The Aussie Sharks suffer an opening loss against Italy in the FINA World League Super Finals.

articles.title: Sam Groth falls in Nottingham Open second round
articles.description: Sam Groth's gallant run at the Nottingham Open has ended with a tough three-set loss to Joao Sousa.

articles.title: Stosur, Dellacqua and Gajdosova all crash out of Wimbledon warm-up
articles.description: Samantha Stosur's poor form on grass continues in the lead up to Wimbledon, as she crashes out of the Eastbourne International.

articles.title: Johnson can outdo Ashes whitewash heroics: Siddle
articles.description: Australian strike bowler Mitchell Johnson could have an even more devastating effect on this Ashes series than the last, according to Peter Siddle.

articles.title: Paris enters running for 2024 Olympics
articles.description: Paris enters race to become host city for the 2024 Olympics, joining Boston, Rome and Hamburg.

articles.title: Australia coach Sheens takes up job with Salford, may leave Kangaroos
articles.description: Australia coach Tim Sheens is to become director of rugby at Super League strugglers Salford, putting his Kangaroos future in doubt.

articles.title: Brumbies ready to pounce against rested Hurricanes, says Larkham
articles.description: Brumbies coach Stephen Larkham believes his side is poised to take advantage of a potentially rusty Hurricanes in their Super rugby semi-final.

articles.title: Foran opens door for Parramatta backflip as Manly is put on alert
articles.description: Manly appears poised to reclaim the services of Kieran Foran after the Kiwi superstar indicated he was willing to turn his back on Parramatta.

articles.title: Lyon to relish England's flat pitches in Ashes
articles.description: Nathan Lyon is ready to embrace the spin-friendly pitches set to be produced in England as Australia endeavours to retain the Ashes.

articles.title: FFA slams Brisbane Roar for unpaid wages
articles.description: The FFA slams Brisbane Roar's failure to pay players and staff for the month of June as the embattled A-League club's financial issues continue to fester.

articles.title: Lions defender McGuire retires as concussion symptoms linger
articles.description: Veteran Brisbane Lions defender Matt Maguire announces his AFL retirement due to ongoing symptoms from a concussion suffered two months ago.

articles.title: Pearce comfortable with Jennings selection for Origin III
articles.description: Mitchell Pearce has backed New South Wales coach Laurie Daley's decision to select his Sydney Roosters team-mate Michael Jennings for State of Origin III.

articles.title: Rugby league opponent referred to judiciary after 25yo's death
articles.description: The player whose tackle tragically ended the life of 25-year-old James Ackerman is referred to the Queensland Rugby League judiciary.

articles.title: The Wrap: June 23
articles.description: Grandstand brings together the best moments from the latest round of football on The Wrap.

articles.title: Jackson fights for spot in Origin decider
articles.description: Canterbury back rower Josh Jackson will fight to get his dangerous throw charge downgraded at the NRL judiciary on Wednesday night in a bid to play in the State of Origin decider in Brisbane.

articles.title: I want to be Cronulla's number one: Barba
articles.description: After playing a starring role against Newcastle on the weekend, Ben Barba says he wants to make the Cronulla full-back jersey his own.

articles.title: Australian PGA championship gets big financial boost
articles.description: The Australian PGA Championship will be co-sanctioned with the European Tour and prizemoney has been lifted to $1.75 million, making it Australia's richest golf tournament.

articles.title: Entrepreneurs take note: women's sport is a seriously untapped market
articles.description: The myth that there's no interest in women's sport is crumbling fast in the wake of the Matildas' World Cup run and the exceptional trans-Tasman netball grand final.

articles.title: USA advances to World Cup quarters, beating 10-woman Colombia
articles.description: The United States progress to the Women's World Cup quarter-finals after beating a 10-woman Colombian outfit 2-0 in Edmonton.

articles.title: Ron Clarke public memorial service to be held in Melbourne
articles.description: A memorial service for Olympic distance runner and former Gold Coast mayor Ron Clarke is to be held in Melbourne next month.

articles.title: No AFL tribunal as Gibbs takes two-match ban
articles.description: Carlton loses Bryce Gibbs for two matches after he accepts ban for sling tackle on Port Adelaide's Robbie Gray.

articles.title: P. Diddy charged with assault with deadly weapon at college campus
articles.description: Sean "P. Diddy" Combs is arrested and charged with assault after getting into a fight with his son's college football coach.

articles.title: A-League to appoint its first professional referees
articles.description: Football Federation Australia will introduce full-time professional referees for the A-League for the first time in 2015/16.

articles.title: Umaga takes over as Blues' Super Rugby coach
articles.description: Former All Blacks captain Tana Umaga has been confirmed as the new coach of the three-time Super Rugby champion Blues and will be tasked with resurrecting the fortunes of New Zealand's richest province.

articles.title: Groth made to wait in rainy Nottingham
articles.description: Big-serving Australian Sam Groth will endure an overnight rain delay as he tries to secure a place in the second round of the Nottingham Open.

articles.title: Former All Black Norm Berryman dies, aged 42
articles.description: Former All Blacks player Norm Berryman has died at the age of 42.

articles.title: Bronze stunner sends England into Women's World Cup quarter-final
articles.description: England advances to the quarter-finals of the Women's World Cup after a stunning goal by Lucy Bronze saw the Lionesses to a 2-1 round-of-16 win over Norway.

articles.title: Kyrgios splits with coach six days out from Wimbledon
articles.description: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios has split with coach Todd Larkham less than a week out from Wimbledon.

articles.title: James Ackerman donated organs so others could live, brother says
articles.description: The Sunshine Coast rugby league player who died in hospital two days after being injured in a tackle has donated his organs, his brother says.

articles.title: Surfing, bowling among new sports nominated for Tokyo Olympics
articles.description: Organisers of the 2020 Games nominate eight new sports for possible inclusion, including baseball, surfing and bowling.

articles.title: Heyman hails Matildas' World Cup chemistry ahead of quarter-final
articles.description: Matildas striker Michelle Heyman says the team is walking a fine line between tight friendships and healthy competition at the Women's World Cup.

articles.title: Wimbledon champion Kvitova withdraws from Eastbourne
articles.description: Reigning Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova will begin her title defence in a week without any official grass-court matches following her withdrawal from the Eastbourne International.

articles.title: Pakistan's Hafeez faces one-year ban over suspect action
articles.description: Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez could be banned from bowling for one year after the part-time off-spinner was again reported by match officials for a suspect action during the Test against Sri Lanka in Galle.

articles.title: Former Kangaroo Quinn dies
articles.description: Former Newtown, Australia and NSW prop Paul Quinn has died after a long illness aged 77.

articles.title: Roosters back in NRL top four with 19-14 win over Dragons
articles.description: The Sydney Roosters return to the NRL top four after a 19-14 win over St George Illawarra thanks to Shaun Kenny-Dowall's two tries.

articles.title: Ryan Hinchcliffe heads to Huddersfield
articles.description: Melbourne Storm forward Ryan Hinchcliffe accepts a three-year offer to join Super League club Huddersfield Giants from 2016.

articles.title: Panthers lose Segeyaro for a month minimum
articles.description: Penrith's injury crisis worsenes with hooker James Segeyaro ruled out for four to six weeks with a knee problem.

articles.title: Live: Parramatta v Dragons
articles.description: Grandstand brings you live updates from round 16 of the NRL, with the Eels meeting the Dragons in Parramatta.

articles.title: Jennings fined by Roosters but cleared for Origin III
articles.description: Blues coach Laurie Daley has chosen not to stand Sydney Roosters centre Michael Jennings down for State of Origin Game III after his arrest on Saturday.

articles.title: 'It still feels like a dream': Queensland Firebirds revel in grand final victory
articles.description: The Queensland Firebirds show off their trophy after Sunday night's down-to-the-wire victory in the trans-Tasman netball grand final.

articles.title: Maradona to run for FIFA presidency: report
articles.description: Argentine soccer great Diego Maradona has decided to stand as a candidate for the FIFA presidency to replace Sepp Blatter, according to a respected Uruguayan journalist.

articles.title: Matildas win hoped to reignite women's sport media coverage debate
articles.description: Leading figures within Australia's soccer community hope the Matildas' historic World Cup win will reignite the debate over the lack of media coverage given to women's sport and the huge pay gap between male and female athletes.

articles.title: Eels confident Foran deal can be fixed
articles.description: Kieran Foran can reportedly ready to tear up his NRL contract with Parramatta due to the Eels trying to change some details of the four-year deal.

articles.title: No fairytale US Open finish for Jason Day
articles.description: Jason Day shot 74, but he, Adam Scott and Cameron Smith all finished in the top 10 on a big final round for the Australians at the US Open.

articles.title: Carlton's Gibbs' offered two-match ban for clash with Gray
articles.description: Carlton's Bryce Gibbs can accept a two-match suspension with an early guilty plea after the AFL Match Review Panel charged him with rough conduct.

articles.title: Matildas striker 'super stoked' with World Cup win over Brazil
articles.description: Matildas striker Kyah Simon, who scored the winner in her side's 1-0 World Cup win over Brazil overnight, says she is "super stoked" with the result.

articles.title: Matildas love being the underdogs
articles.description: Striker Michelle Heyman says the Matildas are relishing their underdog tag as the team's confidence continues to grow heading into the Women's World Cup quarter-finals.

articles.title: World Cup: this was a win for more than the Matildas
articles.description: The Matildas' extraordinary World Cup win against Brazil silenced the non-believers, the doubters, those who said they'd rather watch men play.  Sporting history made - by women.

articles.title: Australia will not cross Ashes sledging line, vows Clarke
articles.description: Australian skipper Michael Clarke says the tourists will not cross the line when it comes to sledging in the upcoming Ashes series.

articles.title: Josh Jackson set to miss Origin due to suspension
articles.description: Canterbury and New South Wales backrower Josh Jackson is facing being rubbed out of Origin III after being charged with a dangerous throw.

articles.title: Rugby league player dies from tackle injuries
articles.description: James Ackerman, a father of two from the Sunshine Coast who was seriously injured in a tackle during a Queensland Cup match on Saturday, dies in hospital.

articles.title: Belanger strike sees Canada past Swiss into last eight
articles.description: The hosts Canada are forced to work hard before beating Switzerland 1-0 to reach the quarter-finals at the Women's World Cup.

articles.title: Jordan Spieth wins dramatic US Open
articles.description: American Jordan Spieth wins a dramatic US Open, beating Dustin Johnson and Louis Oosthuizen by one shot as Australia's Jason Day fades to finish tied for ninth.

articles.title: France beats South Korea 3-0 to reach World Cup quarter-finals
articles.description: France sets up a quarter-final with Germany after a 3-0 win over South Korea at the Women's World Cup.

articles.title: Dellacqua beats Schmiedlova to advance at Eastbourne
articles.description: Casey Dellacqua gets off to a winning start at Eastbourne, beating Slovakia's Anna Karolina Schmiedlova in the first round.

articles.title: Kookaburras thrash France 10-0 in Hockey League
articles.description: The Kookaburras thrash France 10-0 to start their bid for Olympic qualification at the Hockey World League in Belgium.

articles.title: As it happened: Jordan Spieth wins the US Open
articles.description: Jordan Spieth wins the US Open ahead of fellow American Dustin Johnson and South African Louis Oosthuizen after a thrilling finish at Chambers Bay.

articles.title: Mustafizur grabs six as Bangladesh seals series against India
articles.description: Left-arm seamer Mustafizur Rahman rips through the Indian batting line up once again to help Bangladesh seal the three-match one-day international series with a six-wicket win in Dhaka.

articles.title: Jockey dies after fall in trotting race in France
articles.description: A female jockey reportedly dies from injuries sustained in a fall during a trotting race in France.

articles.title: Clarke hits back at Gillespie's 'Dad's Army' jibe
articles.description: Australia captain Michael Clarke says he expects to prove Jason Gillespie wrong after the former Ashes winner said the current squad is too old ahead of its latest clash with England.

articles.title: Kerber targets Wimbledon after debut grass win
articles.description: Angelique Kerber suggests she is back to her best in time for Wimbledon after lifting her first grass-court trophy in a compelling final against Karolina Pliskova in Birmingham.

articles.title: Federer trumps Seppi for eighth Halle title
articles.description: Two-time defending champion Roger Federer trumps Italian Andreas Seppi 7-6 (7/1), 6-4 to win an eighth title at the Halle tournament.

articles.title: Rosberg wins again to cut Hamilton's lead in title race
articles.description: Nico Rosberg snares his third win in four races, beating Mercedes team-mate and series leader Lewis Hamilton to triumph in an incident-filled Austrian grand prix.

articles.title: 'Dangerous' Matildas dump Brazil out of World Cup with 1-0 victory
articles.description: Australia's coach heaps praise on his "dangerous" side after a 1-0 win over powerhouse Brazil sends the Matildas into the quarter-finals of the Women's World Cup.

articles.title: Murray beats Troicki to reach Queen's final
articles.description: Home favourite Andy Murray reached the final at Queen's Club on Sunday by defeating Serbia's Viktor Troicki in a semi-final held over from the previous day because of rain.

articles.title: Hockeyroos smash Poland 9-0 in World Hockey League opener
articles.description: The Hockeyroos get off to a hot start to their World Hockey League campaign in Antwerp, smashing Poland 9-0.

articles.title: Pakistan beats Sri Lanka in first Test
articles.description: Pakistan has defeated Sri Lanka by 10 wickets in the first Test in Galle to take the lead in the three-match series.

articles.title: QRU withdraws from Cooper negotiations
articles.description: The Queensland Rugby Union withdraws its contract offer to Quade Cooper and will not attempt to retain him for the 2016 Super Rugby season.

articles.title: Demons break hoodoo to beat Geelong by 24
articles.description: The improving Melbourne Demons claim a deserved 24-point AFL win over 10th-placed Geelong at Kardinia Park.

articles.title: Broncos pull off backs-to-the wall 14-12 win over Storm
articles.description: The Brisbane Broncos have defeated the Melbourne Storm 14-12 at AAMI Park, making a mockery of the stats book in the process.

articles.title: Firebirds' Tippett goes from zero to hero
articles.description: Firebirds shooter Gretel Tippett experienced the highs and lows of sport in the space of a heartbeat after scoring the winner in the trans-Tasman decider.

articles.title: Reynolds wins first V8 race since 2013
articles.description: Ford's David Reynolds breaks through for his first V8 Supercars win since 2013 in the final race of the round in Darwin.

articles.title: Sharks surge in second half to beat Knights 30-28
articles.description: A trio of second-half tries has proved enough to see the Cronulla Sharks beat the Newcastle Knights 30-28 at Hunter Stadium.

articles.title: Live: Geelong v Melbourne
articles.description: Follow all the AFL action as it happens as Geelong faces Melbourne at Kardinia Park.

articles.title: Courageous Day considered quitting US Open during round three before powering into contention
articles.description: Jason Day battled dizziness during the third round of the US Open and thought about quitting the tournament before battling on to claim a share of the lead.

articles.title: Live: Melbourne Storm v Brisbane Broncos
articles.description: Grandstand brings you live updates from the Melbourne Storm v Brisbane Broncos NRL clash.

articles.title: Firebirds come from behind against Swifts to win trans-Tasman netball championship
articles.description: The Queensland Firebirds win the trans-Tasman netball championship after a nail-biting win over the NSW Swifts in Brisbane.

articles.title: Blues' Origin preparations in disarray
articles.description: Blues forward Josh Jackson is put on report for a lifting tackle, adding to problems for NSW Origin coach Laurie Daley.

articles.title: China edges past Cameroon into last eight at World Cup
articles.description: China qualifies for Women's World Cup quarter-finals with 1-0 win over Cameroon in Edmonton.

articles.title: Day defies vertigo to share lead at US Open
articles.description: Jason Day battles on after his day two collapse with vertigo, shooting a third round 68 to join four-way tie for lead at the US Open.

articles.title: Brazen Beau beaten narrowly at Royal Ascot
articles.description: The Chris Waller-trained Brazen Beau narrowly misses out on victory in the Diamond Jubilee Stakes at Royal Ascot, won by American horse Undrafted.

articles.title: Germany beats Sweden 4-1 to reach Women's World Cup quarters
articles.description: Germany is the first team through to the last eight of the Women's World Cup with a 4-1 demolition of Sweden in Ottawa.

articles.title: 'Baby Blacks' win fifth world Under-20 title
articles.description: New Zealand wins world under-20 rugby union title for fourth time, beating England 21-16 in final, as Australia finishes fifth with win over 28-23 Wales.

articles.title: Pliskova, Kerber into Birmingham final
articles.description: Czech Karolina Pliskova will play Germany's Angelique Kerber after the pair have straight sets wins in Birmingham grass-court tournament.

articles.title: Anderson powers into Queen's final, Murray delayed
articles.description: South African Kevin Anderson beats France's Gilles Simon to qualify for final at Queen's Club.

articles.title: Top seed Federer to face Seppi for eighth Halle title
articles.description: Roger Federer will play Andreas Seppi in the Halle Open final after his win over Ivo Karlovic in the semi-finals.

articles.title: England wins 5th ODI against New Zealand, take series 3-2
articles.description: An unbeaten 83 from stand-in wicketkeeper Jonny Bairstow earns England a rain-affected, three-wicket win over New Zealand to clinch the ODI series 3-2.

articles.title: Tomane hat-trick puts Brumbies in Super Rugby semis
articles.description: Winger Joe Tomane scores a hat-trick as the Brumbies beat the Stormers 39-19 at Newlands to reach Super Rugby semis.

articles.title: Iran VP scolds hardliners over female volleyball fan ban
articles.description: One of Iran's female vice presidents condemns hardline groups who threatened violence after a drive to allow a limited number of female spectators into an international volleyball match.

articles.title: Hamilton on pole for Austrian Grand Prix, Ricciardo struggles
articles.description: Lewis Hamilton took pole at the Austrian Grand Prix while Daniel Ricciardo had a day to forget.

articles.title: Shafiq ton helps Pakistan regain control of first Test against Sri Lanka
articles.description: Asad Shafiq's seventh hundred and a belligerent 96 from Sarfraz Ahmed helped give Pakistan a sizeable lead against Sri Lanka on the fourth day of the opening Test at Galle on Saturday.

articles.title: Classy Bulldogs thrash Lions
articles.description: The Western Bulldogs' multi-million dollar forward Tom Boyd enjoyed a coming-of-age performance on Saturday night in the club's 72-point win over Brisbane at Docklands.

articles.title: Bulldogs maul Panthers for comfortable 24-12 NRL win
articles.description: The Canterbury Bulldogs have prove too strong for the Penrith Panthers, running away with a 24-12 win at Sydney Olympic stadium.

articles.title: Warriors overcome slow start to beat Titans 36-14
articles.description: The New Zealand Warriors continue their excellent recent record on the Gold Coast, beating the Titans 30-14 at Robina.

articles.title: Gritty Highlanders survive Chiefs test
articles.description: The Highlanders advanced to the Super Rugby semi-finals following a hard-fought 24-14 win over New Zealand rivals the Chiefs in Dunedin.

articles.title: Kangaroos belt Giants by 56 to climb into top 10
articles.description: North Melbourne climbs into the AFL top 10 with an easy 56-point win over Greater Western Sydney at the Showgrounds.

articles.title: Daley to make Origin call on Jennings
articles.description: New South Wales coach Laurie Daley says he wants to know the full details before deciding whether to select Michael Jennings for the State of Origin decider in Brisbane next month.

articles.title: Maksimovic late goal gives Serbia U20 World Cup title over Brazil
articles.description: Nemanja Maksimovic's 118th minute goal gives Serbia a 2-1 extra-time victory over Brazil in the under-20 World Cup final.

articles.title: Cowboys keep winning streak alive with late Thurston field goal
articles.description: A Johnathan Thurston field goal after the full-time siren kept North Queensland's winning streak alive with a 21-20 triumph over the Raiders at Canberra Stadium.

articles.title: Srikandi wins Group One Tattersall's Tiara
articles.description: Victorian mare Srikandi completes a Queensland Group One double, winning the Tattersall's Tiara at the Gold Coast.

articles.title: Firebirds approaching trans-Tasman decider against Swifts with calm confidence
articles.description: The Queensland Firebirds are heading into the trans-Tasman netball decider against the NSW Swifts with more confidence than in the past two editions.

articles.title: Carlton shocks Port Adelaide in gritty MCG classic
articles.description: Carlton wins its first game on home soil this season, beating Port Adelaide by four points in a remarkable AFL clash at the MCG.

articles.title: Lowndes chalks up 100th V8 win in Darwin
articles.description: Evergreen Craig Lowndes becomes the first driver in V8 Supercars history to win a century of championship races.

articles.title: Live: Canterbury Bulldogs v Penrith Panthers
articles.description: Grandstand brings you live updates from the Canterbury Bulldogs v Penrith Panthers NRL clash.

articles.title: Matildas prepare for Brazil at Women's World Cup
articles.description: The Matildas are confident in their ability to stun Brazil and claim a quarter-final berth at the Women's World Cup.

articles.title: Live: Western Bulldogs v Brisbane Lions
articles.description: Follow all the AFL action as it happens as thee Western Bulldogs take on the Brisbane Lions at Docklands.

articles.title: Engineers 'confident' leak at Canberra Olympic Pool can be fixed
articles.description: The outdoor facilities at the Canberra Olympic Pool in Civic are likely to win a reprieve, with engineers confident leaks that have plagued the facility can be fixed.

articles.title: Tiger Woods tumbles out at US Open, Spieth in the lead
articles.description: Jordan Spieth remains on track for a rare US Masters-US Open double, taking the lead in the second round, while Tiger Woods's shambolic form continues.

articles.title: Knights hopes boosted by the return of  key players
articles.description: A rested Newcastle Knights will be boosted by the return of several key players when they take on Cronulla tomorrow afternoon.

articles.title: People's champion Takeover Target dies at 15
articles.description: Champion sprinter Takeover Target dies at the age of 15, euthanised after a paddock accident at his owner Joe Janiak's property.

articles.title: Richmond defender Alex Rance re-signs for four seasons
articles.description: Richmond secures the services of key defender Alex Rance, who re-signs with the Tigers for four more seasons.

articles.title: Remote community children study at football leadership centre
articles.description: Children from the remote Arnhem Land community of Maningrida are the first group of students selected to spend a week at the Michael Long Learning and Leadership Centre in Darwin.

articles.title: Tsonga in Wimbledon fitness fight after Nottingham pullout
articles.description: French player Jo-Wilfried Tsonga withdraws from Wimbledon leadup event in Nottingham with injury.

articles.title: Tour de France may withdraw from 2016 UCI calendar
articles.description: Tour de France organisers threaten to split from UCI 2016 calendar if reform program does not go forward.

articles.title: Sebastian Vettel quickest in Austrian F1 practice
articles.description: Ferrari driver Sebastian Vettel sets fastest lap in practice for the Austrian Formula One grand prix.

articles.title: Jockey Moore the merrier after setting Royal Ascot win record
articles.description: English jockey Ryan Moore breaks post-war record with his ninth win of the Royal Ascot meeting.

articles.title: Simona Halep falls as Lisicki storms on in Birmingham
articles.description: Romanian top seed Simona Halep loses to Kristina Mladenovic in quarter-finals at Birmingham.

articles.title: Jason Day collapses with vertigo at US Open
articles.description: Australian golfer Jason Day has collapsed on the course at the US Open, suffering from dizziness and vertigo.

articles.title: Andy Murray survives Gilles Muller scare to make Queen's semis
articles.description: Andy Murray has survived a scare by Gilles Muller to qualify for the semi-finals at Queen's Club.

articles.title: Karlovic hits record aces, Federer through to Halle semis
articles.description: Croatian Ivo Karlovic set an ATP Tour record, serving 45 aces to beat Tomas Berdych at the Halle Open, setting up a semi-final with Roger Federer.

articles.title: Sri Lankan bowlers put Pakistan in trouble in first Test
articles.description: Sri Lanka takes the upper hand on the third day of the opening test at Galle on Friday, reducing Pakistan to 5 for 118.

articles.title: Farah says missed drug tests were 'simple mistakes'
articles.description: Britain's Olympic gold medallist Mo Farah takes to social media to confront drug speculation.

articles.title: Port Adelaide reveals hi-tech fitness regime
articles.description: The Port Adelaide football club's cutting-edge use of data and sports science to complement its fitness program offers a unique insight into the hi-tech future of elite sports.

articles.title: Eagles win to keep pressure on Dockers
articles.description: West Coast's formidable forward line kicked the Eagles back into the top two of the AFL ladder with an impressive 20-point win over Richmond at the MCG.

articles.title: Sea Eagles hold off tenacious Tigers for Brookvale win
articles.description: Manly defeats Wests Tigers 30-20 on a slippery Brookvale Oval surface, with Brett Stewart and Kieran Foran the stars of the show.

articles.title: Ricciardo faces 10-place grid penalty at Austrian Grand Prix as Red Bull struggles with engines
articles.description: Red Bull's Daniel Ricciardo and Daniil Kvyat face 10-place grid penalties at the Austrian Grand Prix after exceeding their engine allocation for the season.

articles.title: Wimbledon wildcard for Aussie Ebden
articles.description: In-form Matt Ebden has been rewarded with a Wimbledon wildcard, giving Australia at least 12 players in the main draw of the grass court major starting on Monday week.

articles.title: Pritchard to leave Canterbury for England
articles.description: Canterbury back rower Frank Pritchard will leave the NRL at the end of the season after signing with English Super League club Hull FC.

articles.title: Formula One in sorry state: Webber
articles.description: Former F1 driver Mark Webber says the sport is currently in a sorry state, with drivers and fans unhappy about the rules.

articles.title: Demons lose Hogan for Cats AFL clash
articles.description: Melbourne suffered a blow ahead of Sunday's match against Geelong with young star Jesse Hogan ruled out with hamstring soreness.

articles.title: Relay held in PNG in build up to Pacific Games
articles.description: Papua New Guineans run a celebratory relay in the build up to the 2015 Pacific Games, set to kick off July 4.

articles.title: SA jockey taken to hospital following fall during jumps trial
articles.description: South Australian jockey Amy Herrmann is taken to hospital following a fall during a jumps trial at Morphettville.

articles.title: Scans reveal Gallen suffering from popped rib cartilage, likely to be fit for Origin III
articles.description: Blues captain Paul Gallen popped a rib cartilage in Origin II, scans reveal, but he will likely be fit to play in the series decider.

articles.title: Woods sinks to bottom at Chambers Bay
articles.description: Tiger Woods sunk to the bottom of the US Open leaderboard after an opening round 80, but he vowed to fight on and return to the top.

articles.title: Roosters five-eighth Maloney signs for Sharks on three-year deal
articles.description: The Sydney Roosters have confirmed five-eighth James Maloney will join the Cronulla Sharks on a three-year NRL deal.

articles.title: Heyman wants Matildas No.9 shirt back
articles.description: Michelle Heyman is hungry to win back her starting spot from Matildas team-mate Kyah Simon for their knockout Women's World Cup match with Brazil.

articles.title: Wallabies to host England in three Tests
articles.description: Brisbane's Lang Park, Melbourne's AAMI Park and the Sydney Football Stadium will host the Wallabies' three-Test series against England in 2016.

articles.title: Swifts underdogs against Firebirds
articles.description: The NSW Swifts are poised to start six Australian internationals in the trans-Tasman netball final, but will go in as underdogs against the Queensland Firebirds.

articles.title: ARU sell Melbourne Rebels to private investment group
articles.description: The cash-strapped Australian Rugby Union has receives a financial boost with the sale of the Melbourne Rebels Super Rugby franchise to a private investment group.

articles.title: Reynolds fastest in Darwin V8s practice
articles.description: Ford's David Reynolds sets a new V8 Supercars lap record at Darwin's Hidden Valley during practice.

articles.title: AFL strikes gold with Thursday night football
articles.description: As the AFL continues to tinker with its fixturing conventions, Thursday night matches may have become the best result for all involved.

articles.title: Competitive dogs sniffing out new levels of sport
articles.description: Sniffing dogs of all ages are getting a sense of positive reinforcement in a new sport that is coming to Hobart.

articles.title: Kirwan resigns as Blues coach
articles.description: Sir John Kirwan resigns as coach of the Blues' Super Rugby team after overseeing their worst-ever season.

articles.title: Palmer originally cleared of doping violation before WADA appealed ruling
articles.description: FINA reveals Olympic gold medallist Kylie Palmer was originally cleared 18 months ago of the alleged doping violation that now threatens to derail her swimming career.

articles.title: Crows plan to match Cats' Dangerfield offer to force clubs to trade table
articles.description: Adelaide could look to match Geelong's offer for out-of-contract Crows star Patrick Dangerfield in an attempt to force the Cats to the trade table, reports suggest.

articles.title: Day makes solid start at US Open, three behind leaders
articles.description: Australian Jason Day sits three shots off the lead after a solid opening round at the US Open at Chambers Bay.

articles.title: Bangladesh stuns India for 79-run ODI win
articles.description: Bangladesh pulls off a shock 79-run over two-time world champion India in their first ODI match in Dhaka.

articles.title: Murray progresses with ease at Queen's Court
articles.description: Andy Murray eases through to the Queen's Court quarter-finals as Gilles Muller upsets sixth seed Grigor Dimitrov.

articles.title: Gallen confident of playing Origin III despite rib injury
articles.description: New South Wales captain Paul Gallen remains confident he will recover from a rib injury sustained in Origin II on Wednesday in time for game three on July 8.

articles.title: Crows lose injured Walker in defeat to Hawks
articles.description: Adelaide captain Taylor Walker was subbed off with injury in the Crows' 29-point loss to premiers Hawthorn at Adelaide Oval on Thursday evening.

articles.title: Rooster Moa found guilty at judiciary
articles.description: Sydney Roosters prop Sam Moa will miss his side's clash with St George Illawarra at the Sydney Football Stadium on Monday after failing to contest a contrary conduct charge at the judiciary.

articles.title: PNG police to use surveillance balloons for Pacific Games safety
articles.description: The police commissioner of Papua New Guinea says increased security measures will ensure the safety of athletes and visitors at next month's Pacific Games in Port Moresby.

articles.title: Brisbane City to open NRC defence with grand final re-match
articles.description: Brisbane City will open its National Rugby Championship defence with a grand final re-match against Perth Spirit at Ballymore in August to kick off the second edition of Australian rugby's third-tier competition.

articles.title: Uncapped Footitt in England's Ashes training squad
articles.description: Uncapped left-arm paceman Mark Footitt was included in England's 14-man squad announced for a pre-Ashes training camp in Spain.

articles.title: Dal Santo returns from injury for Kangaroos
articles.description: North Melbourne has called on Nick Dal Santo for the first time in 10 rounds with the midfielder finally overcoming a hamstring strain.

articles.title: Live: Adelaide v Hawthorn
articles.description: Follow all the AFL action as it happens as Adelaide hosts reigning premier Hawthorn at the Adelaide Oval.
